proverbs.author: zhang, 1078 AD
proverbs.proverb: Those who are good at winning, don't usually fight.

proverbs.author: zhang, 1078 AD
proverbs.proverb: Those who are good at making shape don't usually fight.

proverbs.author: zhong-pu liu, 1078 AD
proverbs.proverb: Never be too sure about your plan, and always doubt your ability to kill your opponent's stones.

proverbs.author: zhong-pu liu, 1078 AD
proverbs.proverb: Fighting must not be the key to go, it should be reserved as your last resource.

proverbs.author: Chinese proverb
proverbs.proverb: If you cannot succeed, then die gloriously

proverbs.author: Go Seigen, 9p, 1994
proverbs.proverb: Go is essentially a form of harmony. Go in the 21st century will have to be go of the 'harmony of the six points - the four quarters, the above and the below.' As in life we will need to view the whole rather than the part. Japanese go has focused too heavily on the local (joseki) rather than the whole for 300 years. The reason the Chinese and Koreans are overtaking the Japanese is that they are closer to achieving this whole-board view.

proverbs.author: Otake Hideo, 9p
proverbs.proverb: When your opponent is thick, you must also become thick.

proverbs.author: Otake Hideo, 9p
proverbs.proverb: In opponents' sphere of influence, avoid sharp conflict, don't move too deep

proverbs.author: Yang Yilun, 7p
proverbs.proverb: 5 lines for extension in front of shimari

proverbs.author: Yang Yilun, 7p
proverbs.proverb: To invade, need 20 points in open area; otherwise, keshi is best.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Go is a game of chance where the strong player is he who renders circumstances favorable with tricks.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Everything happens on a grid-engraved board with black and white pieces, but if that's all you see then you don't know Go.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: The game plays itself, the players don't control it.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: There are possible things, impossible things, and things that happen. Sometimes things happen that were impossible.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: The possibility or impossibility of an event results logically from the rules.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: From the way the players perceive what can happen and what shouldn't happen springs what happens.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: The nature of a game comes from what is played, but it's the sensitivity to the possible and the impossible that gives it value.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: (A shicho works or doesn't work, but sometimes you don't see it, you don't play it). The possible and the impossible are visible and invisible. What happens is always what you see, what is played.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Territory really exists only in the end.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: There are lines, like roots, that plunge into the stone and shatter it.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: The intersection is rarely neutral.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: The stone in the bowl is idiotic.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: There are players who clack down ridiculous moves. Certain others place their moves with crisp, dry contact, like bones cracking. Still others drop their stones with a soft sound.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: In the sound of the stone your can hear its purpose.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: To emphasize the lack of determination in his moves, one speaks of chance.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: One is never aware enough of the violence in go.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: You have to like to win, and to learn to recognize the errors that gave you the victory.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Sometimes an idiotic stone loafs about the goban.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Does white await black's errors? Certainly, in two ways: either he makes clean, clear, dangerous moves; or he makes confusing, twisted moves that are just as dangerous. The adequate answers are always difficult to find.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: If black doesn't pile up enough errors to lose, then it will soon be time to lower the handicap.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Very few good moves are played.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: There is a time and a space which are the same in all go games: the alternating of black and white, and the intersections.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: This time and this space have certain properties, and for a long time, to progress means to become familiar with them.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: You must incessantly question yourself about this time and this space.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: The ax's handle rots while the mind lives to the rhythm of the stones.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Territory is a closed space where time no longer exists. The transformation around it slowly alter it, and sometimes it cracks open like a rotten egg at the least shock.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Beginner's games are surprising, often incoherent and incomprehensible. When you improve, your game gains in consistency but flirts with stupidity: you become satisfied with truisms and mechanical movements, you try to obtain a feeling for clearness and style the easy way.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: You can hide nothing on the goban.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Everything would seem to be possible in go. Like pulling a rabbit, by a magical move, out of a hat.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: (Any move that follows the rules is legal). Possibilities differ according to strength.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Josekis are not fixed, definitive things. They indicate the moments when everything can change.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Learning josekis by heart is useless if you don't try departing from them.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Go is not a blocking game, it's a game of action.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Every move brings change.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: There are players who don't accept exchanges: they play many moves that perpetuate a previous state of the game.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Error is one of the sources of transformation.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: There is a time for doing things.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: You must always consider the circumstances. Nothing is identical, yet things repeat.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Nothing requires doing this or that, but necessity exists.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: To do or not to do something is not determined by what is done in general, any more than by what is necessary. Doing or not doing something is determined by what you want, and to want in go is to want to win.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Contesting, destabilizing, and threatening are sources of transformation.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: Balance is not what players strive for, and if it does arise, it is in spite of them.

proverbs.author: Audouard, Pierre
proverbs.proverb: It is difficult to know exactly what you are doing.

proverbs.author: Fairbairn, John
proverbs.proverb: More haste less speed.

proverbs.author: Kent, David
proverbs.proverb: If White takes all four corners, Black should resign; if Black takes all four corners, Black should also resign.

proverbs.author: Kim, Jay H.
proverbs.proverb: Make a fist before striking

proverbs.author: Sand, Tero
proverbs.proverb: Proverbs do not apply to White.

proverbs.author: Taylor, Bill
proverbs.proverb: Grab the 4th point of the bamboo joint.

proverbs.author: Taylor, Bill
proverbs.proverb: A knight's move near the edge of the board cannot be cut.

proverbs.author: Taylor, Bill
proverbs.proverb: When in doubt, remove the enemy stones from the board.

proverbs.author: Taylor, Bill
proverbs.proverb: Turn, turn, turn!

proverbs.author: Taylor, Bill
proverbs.proverb: Don't reduce your own liberties.

proverbs.author: Taylor, Bill
proverbs.proverb: The weak player fears ko, the strong player seeks it.

proverbs.author: Taylor, Bill
proverbs.proverb: Don't defend - extend!

proverbs.author: Taylor, Bill
proverbs.proverb: Keep your own stones connected, and your opponent's apart.

proverbs.author: Figaro
proverbs.proverb: Always remember, keep the balance (between territory and influence)

proverbs.author: Tamino
proverbs.proverb: In an unreasonable situation, an unreasonable move is reasonable

proverbs.author: jansteen
proverbs.proverb: A basic: Don't push too hard.

proverbs.author: jansteen
proverbs.proverb: In the opening, when you don't know what to play, make a shimari.

proverbs.author: jansteen
proverbs.proverb: There is a thin line between thick and slow.

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: When you study joseki, you lose two stones in strength

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't try to enclose an open skirt

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Play slow, win slow; play fast, lose fast

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Do not make moves that strengthen your opponent!

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Keep sente in the opening. A premature attack loses sente

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Keshi is worth as much as an invasion!

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Only amateurs try to come up with fancy moves

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't count territory held by only one eye!

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Grab the border point between two moyos

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Defend weak groups, not strong groups

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't get surrounded! Ever!

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The simplest move is the best move

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Hane? Extend! Make it a habit

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: White is always trying to kill a bigger group than black is trying to save

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Grab the shape points as kikashi

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Five liberties for tactical stability

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't play on dame points, but guarantee connections

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Be a little patient. Keshi works!

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Conservative and slow will win. Believe it!

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Thickness? Ladders always work! [or don't work if it belongs to your opponent!]

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Dead group? Always win ko fights!

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Make your own groups strong first, then attack

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The book says don't fight (The pen is mightier than the sword). But what else can be expected from a book (written by a pen)?

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: On the second line six die, eight live

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: On the third line, four die, six live

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: In the corner, five stones in a row on the third line are alive

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Six eyes in a rectangle are alive

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: For rectangular six in the corner, dame is necessary

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If one player chooses influence, the other player may choose territory, and vice versa

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The comb formation is alive

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: For the comb formation in the corner, dame is necessary

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The carpenter's square becomes ko

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If there is no stone on the handicap point, the carpenter's square is dead

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: There is death in the hane

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Strange things happen at the one-two points

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If a formation is symmetrical, play at the center

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Against three in a row, play right in the center

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The semeai where only one player has an eye is a fight over nothing

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: There are times when even a fight over nothing means something

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If there is a ko inside a semeai, capture it on the final play

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Learn the eye-stealing tesuji

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't make empty triangles

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't make compact groups of stones

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: At the head of two stones in a row, play hane

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: At the head of three stones in a row, play hane

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Shoulder connections, hanging connections, and knight's move connections

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If your stone is capped, play the knight's move

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Beware of the clumsy double contact

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't play in direct contact with the opponent's stone caught in your squeeze-play

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't make a play adjacent to a cutting-point

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Capture what you cut off

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Never try to cut bamboo joints

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If you have one stone on the third line, add another, then abandon both of them

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Answer the keima with a kosumi

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Beware of going back to patch up your plays

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The monkey jump is worth eight points

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The poor player plays the opponent's game for him

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If you have lost four corners, resign

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If you have won four corners, resign

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Pon-nuki is worth thirty points

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: One point in the center is worth ten in the corner

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: To reduce an opponent's large prospective territory, strike at the shoulder

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If you plan to live inside enemy territory, play directly against his stones

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Knight's moves win running battles

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: When your opponent has two weak groups, attack them both at once

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The enemy's vital point is your own

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Add one stone, then sacrifice both

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The saki bottle shape is negative

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: There is no territory in the centre

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: 2-1 is the vital point in the corner

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Fill in a semiai from the outside

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Groups mustn't float

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The strong player plays straight, the weak diagonally

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If you lose by one point, take a rest

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Win the early ko to win the game

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Attach to the strongest stone in a pincer

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Keep away from thickness

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Five groups might live but the sixth will die

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Win the stones, lose the game

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't make territory near thickness

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Sacrifice small to take large

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Corner, side, centre

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Extend one hand from the cross-cut

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Good moves and bad moves are bedfellows

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't peep at cutting points

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Take the cutting stone on the second line

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The second line is the line of defeat, the third line is the line of territory, and the fourth line is the line of influence

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The rectangular six is normally alive

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Stop on second, extend on third

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: If you don't know ladders, don't play go

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Strike at the waist of the knight's move

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Sacrifice and squeeze

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Empty triangles are bad

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Atari, atari is vulgar play

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Keep inessential ataris till the end

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Avoid the plate connection

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: A meijin needs no joseki

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Big groups never die

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Ikken tobi is never wrong

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Strange things happen at the one-two points

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: The L-group is dead

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't overlook the edge of the board

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: There is damezumari at the bamboo joint

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Learn to play under the stones

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Eyes win semiais

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't make dango's

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Know the eye-stealing tesuji

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Connect with good shape

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't disturb symmetry

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: From a cross-cut, extend

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Use the Knight's move to attack, the 1-point jump to defend

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Attack two weak groups simultaneously

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Sacrifice for shape

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: With only one group, you will win

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Each step in a ladder is worth 7 points

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: With less than 15 stones in danger, tenuki

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Do not fear furikawari

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: One big eye kills one small eye

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Seek small gains but incur big losses

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Don't be greedy!

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: When in a winning position, keep the game simple; Make it complex only when losing

proverbs.author: anonymous
proverbs.proverb: Use a wall to attack, not to make territory
